title: C.2 Probability
content:
Section C.2

Probability

Summary

Basic probability theory.

Key Points

  • Sample space S, event A ⊆ S
  • Pr{A} = |A|/|S| for uniform distribution
  • Pr{A ∪ B} = Pr{A} + Pr{B} - Pr{A ∩ B}
  • Conditional: Pr{A|B} = Pr{A ∩ B}/Pr{B}
  • Independence: Pr{A ∩ B} = Pr{A} · Pr{B}

Example

Two dice: Pr{sum = 7} = 6/36 = 1/6. Pr{sum = 7 | first die = 3} = 1/6.

Why It Matters

Analyzing randomized algorithms and average case.
